page.title: 15TOURISM IN CAYTON
page.content: The main attraction, Wallis's Cayton Bay Holiday Centre, started as a holiday camp in the 1930's, was taken over by Wallis's in 1946 and by Ladbrokes in 1981. The complex covers 38 hectares and has a hall for shows, dancing etc. There is a cinema, shops, indoor pool and well equipped children's playground with organized games. The number of people employed is 180 in summer, 18 in winter when a social club continues for local people. Most employees live in or near Cayton. There are 68 motel villas, 24 bungalows and 536 caravans. Up to 3500 people can be catered for. People come from Teesside/Tyneside (25%) Yorkshire (30%) Scotland (20%) Midlands (10%) Other places (15%). Dalby's camping site in Cayton has 150 sites, with a shop and toilet block.
